item.title: Introduction to PostgreSQL Indexes
item.description: Basics Indexes are special database objects primarily designed to increase the speed of data access, by allowing the database to read less data from the disk. They can also be used to enforce constraints like primary keys, unique keys and exclusion. Indexes are important for performance but do not speedup a query unless the query matches the columns and data types in the index. Also, as a very rough rule of thumb, an index will only help if less than 15-20% of the table will be returned in he query, otherwise the query planner might prefer a sequential scan.
